texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: i3 has been my window manager of choice for a while and I really enjoy its simplicity and ease of use. I use plenty of gtk applications, such as Firefox and Evolution, and configuring them within i3 can be confusing.
texts.text: i3 has been my window manager of choice for a while and I really enjoy its simplicity and ease of use. I use plenty of gtk applications, such as Firefox and Evolution, and configuring them within i3 can be confusing.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: This post covers a few methods to change configurations for GNOME and gtk applications from i3.
texts.text: This post covers a few methods to change configurations for GNOME and gtk applications from i3.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: lxappearance
texts.text: lxappearance

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Almost all of the gtk theming settings are available in  lxappearance . You can change fonts, mouse cursors, icons, and colors. The application makes the changes easy to preview and you can install more icon sets if you wish.
texts.text: Almost all of the gtk theming settings are available in  lxappearance . You can change fonts, mouse cursors, icons, and colors. The application makes the changes easy to preview and you can install more icon sets if you wish.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Fedora already has lxappearance packaged and ready to go:
texts.text: Fedora already has lxappearance packaged and ready to go:

texts.label: code
texts.orig:
$ sudo dnf install lxappearance
$ lxappearance
texts.text:
$ sudo dnf install lxappearance
$ lxappearance

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Although style changes are immediately applied in lxappearance, you need to restart all gtk applications to see the style changes there.
texts.text: Although style changes are immediately applied in lxappearance, you need to restart all gtk applications to see the style changes there.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: lxappearance writes GTK 2.0 and GTK 3.0 configuration files:
texts.text: lxappearance writes GTK 2.0 and GTK 3.0 configuration files:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: GTK 2.0:
texts.text: GTK 2.0:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: GTK 3.0:
texts.text: GTK 3.0:

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: gnome-control-center
texts.text: gnome-control-center

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Recent versions of GNOME bundle all of the system settings into a single application called
texts.text: Recent versions of GNOME bundle all of the system settings into a single application called

texts.label: code
texts.orig: gnome-control-center
texts.text: gnome-control-center

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: . This normally starts right up in GNOME, but i3 is a little trickier since it doesn't have some of the same environment variables set:
texts.text: . This normally starts right up in GNOME, but i3 is a little trickier since it doesn't have some of the same environment variables set:

texts.label: code
texts.orig:
$ gnome-control-center
**
ERROR:../shell/cc-shell-model.c:458:cc_shell_model_set_panel_visibility: assertion failed: (valid)
[1]    837 abort (core dumped)  gnome-control-center
texts.text:
$ gnome-control-center
**
ERROR:../shell/cc-shell-model.c:458:cc_shell_model_set_panel_visibility: assertion failed: (valid)
[1]    837 abort (core dumped)  gnome-control-center

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: The problem is a missing environment variable:
texts.text: The problem is a missing environment variable:

texts.label: code
texts.orig: XDG_CURRENT_DESKTOP
texts.text: XDG_CURRENT_DESKTOP

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: . We can set that on the command line and everything works:
texts.text: . We can set that on the command line and everything works:

texts.label: code
texts.orig: env XDG_CURRENT_DESKTOP=GNOME gnome-control-center
texts.text: env XDG_CURRENT_DESKTOP=GNOME gnome-control-center

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: gnome-tweaks
texts.text: gnome-tweaks

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: The
texts.text: The

texts.label: code
texts.orig: gnome-tweaks
texts.text: gnome-tweaks

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: application has been around for a long time and it works well from i3. Install it in Fedora and run it:
texts.text: application has been around for a long time and it works well from i3. Install it in Fedora and run it:

texts.label: code
texts.orig:
$ sudo dnf install gnome-tweaks
$ gnome-tweaks
texts.text:
$ sudo dnf install gnome-tweaks
$ gnome-tweaks

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Although many of the configurations inside gnome-tweaks match up with lxappearance, gnome-tweaks offers an added benefit: it changes the configuration inside GNOME's key-based configuration system (dconf). This is required for some applications, such as Firefox.
texts.text: Although many of the configurations inside gnome-tweaks match up with lxappearance, gnome-tweaks offers an added benefit: it changes the configuration inside GNOME's key-based configuration system (dconf). This is required for some applications, such as Firefox.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: You can also open up
texts.text: You can also open up

texts.label: code
texts.orig: dconf-editor
texts.text: dconf-editor

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: and make these changes manually in
texts.text: and make these changes manually in

texts.label: code
texts.orig: /org/gnome/desktop/interface
texts.text: /org/gnome/desktop/interface

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: , but gnome-tweaks has a much more user-friendly interface.
texts.text: , but gnome-tweaks has a much more user-friendly interface.
